meanings.definition: A person belonging to a tribe or group considered uncivilized or primitive.
meanings.sent1: The explorer encountered a barbaris in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The history book described the barbaris tribes of ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The children played pretend, pretending to be barbaris warriors.
meanings.sent4: The roar of the barbaris echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The image of the barbaris with a spear was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of barbarians.
meanings.sent1: The barbaris language sounded strange to the travelers.
meanings.sent2: The ancient artifacts displayed barbaris symbols and patterns.
meanings.sent3: The barbaris decorations on the walls gave the room a wild look.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a barbaris quality that was infectious.
meanings.sent5: The barbaris customs were different but intriguing to learn about.

meanings.sent1: The barbaris of the metal scraping against the floor made him cringe.
meanings.sent2: The barbaris of the chalk on the blackboard was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The barbaris of the car engine struggling to start was comical.
meanings.sent4: The barbaris of the wind howling through the night was eerie.
meanings.sent5: The barbaris of the thunderstorm kept them awake all night.
